# AdvisorTouch

## Overview
- **Website:** https://www.advisortouch.com (archived)
- **Category:** Financial Advisory Consulting & Training Services
- **Description:** AdvisorTouch (formerly Fox Financial Planning Network) is a consulting and training business for financial advisors, founded in 2009 by Deborah Fox. The company provides business consulting, practice management systems, workflow documentation, and training programs to help financial advisors systematize and grow their practices. AdvisorTouch is NOT a software vendor but a consulting/training service provider.
- **Status:** Active (consulting/training business)
- **Last Updated:** 2026-02-11

## Pricing Tiers

| Tier | Price (Annual) | Price (Monthly) | User Limit | Key Features |
|------|----------------|-----------------|------------|--------------|
| Basic | Not publicly disclosed | Not publicly disclosed | 1-3 advisors | Core consulting, workflow systems |
| Standard | Not publicly disclosed | Not publicly disclosed | 3-10 advisors | Training programs, documentation |
| Enterprise | Not publicly disclosed | Not publicly disclosed | 10+ advisors | Comprehensive consulting, full system |

### Notes on Pricing
- **Pricing Structure:** Consulting/training services (not subscription software)
- **Pricing Model:** Typically project-based or retainer
- **Contact Required:** All pricing requires direct consultation
- **Founder-Led:** Deborah Fox leads consulting engagements
- **Contact:** (858) 768-2520, [email protected]
- **Target Market:** Financial advisors seeking practice management consulting

## Key Features

### Core Capabilities (All Services)
- **Workflow Documentation:** Comprehensive systematization of advisor processes
- **Practice Management Consulting:** Business consulting for financial advisors
- **Training Programs:** Educational content for advisors and staff
- **Process Standardization:** Turnkey system for efficient operations
- **Technology Integration:** Guidance on technology stack selection
- **Client Service Excellence:** Training on superior client service delivery

### Advanced Services (Higher Tiers)

#### Business Consulting
- **Strategic Planning:** Business growth and planning strategies
- **Practice Management:** Operations and efficiency optimization
- **Team Development:** Staff training and organizational structure
- **Compliance Guidance:** Documentation and compliance support
- **Marketing & Client Acquisition:** Business development strategies

#### Implementation Support
- **System Implementation:** Hands-on support for system deployment
- **Ongoing Optimization:** Continuous improvement guidance
- **Customization:** Tailored solutions for specific practice needs

### Enterprise-Only Services
- **Full Practice Transformation:** Comprehensive business overhaul
- **Dedicated Consulting:** Ongoing one-on-one advisory
- **Custom Documentation:** Branded workflows and processes
- **Group Training:** In-person and virtual team training
- **Annual Reviews:** Regular business health assessments

### Limitations
- **Not Software:** AdvisorTouch is consulting, not a software product
- **Cost Uncertainty:** No public pricing (requires consultation)
- **Time Investment:** Consulting requires significant advisor time commitment
- **Geographic Reach:** Primarily US-based (San Diego, CA)
- **Team Size:** Small consulting firm

## Integrations

### Integration Overview
- **Total Integrations:** N/A (consulting service)
- **Technology Guidance:** AdvisorTouch provides technology stack recommendations
- **Focus Areas:** Practice management tools, CRM, financial planning software
- **Approach:** Vendor-agnostic consulting

### Technology Stack Guidance (Not Direct Integrations)

AdvisorTouch provides recommendations for technology stacks but does not have direct software integrations. They guide advisors on:

#### Recommended Software Categories
- **CRM Systems:** Guidance on selecting and implementing CRM
- **Financial Planning Software:** Recommendations for planning tools
- **Portfolio Management:** Advice on portfolio management platforms
- **Document Management:** Systems for document storage and sharing
- **Communication Tools:** Email, video conferencing, client portals

#### Vendor Recommendations (Based on Practice Needs)
AdvisorTouch consultants help advisors select appropriate vendors based on:
- Practice size and growth stage
- Client demographics and needs
- Technology preferences and capabilities
- Budget constraints
- Compliance requirements

### Integration Types Available
- **Software Recommendations:** Guidance on technology selection
- **Implementation Support:** Hands-on help with software deployment
- **Workflow Integration:** Help integrating tools into practice workflows
- **Staff Training:** Training on using selected software

**Note:** AdvisorTouch does not have direct software integrations. Their value is in consulting on technology selection and practice management systems.

## Evaluation Notes

### Pros
- **Founder Expertise:** Deborah Fox has 30+ years as practicing advisor
- **Industry Recognition:** InvestmentNews Innovator 2020, cover of Financial Planning magazine
- **Proven System:** Turnkey system for practice management
- **Client Testimonials:** Strong positive feedback from advisors
- **Personalized Service:** Founder-led consulting
- **Comprehensive Approach:** Covers technology, people, processes
- **Long Track Record:** Founded 2009, consulting since 2004
- **Practice Management Focus:** Addresses real advisor challenges
- **Flexible Models:** Works with various advisor business models
- **Revenue Opportunities:** Fox College Funding referral program

### Cons
- **Not Software:** Consulting service, not a software product
- **No Public Pricing:** Requires direct consultation
- **Time Investment:** Requires significant advisor time commitment
- **Geographic Limitations:** Primarily US-based (San Diego, CA)
- **Small Firm:** Limited team size
- **No API/Technical Resources:** Not a technology platform
- **Relationship-Based:** Success depends on consultant relationship
- **No Self-Service Option:** Requires consulting engagement
- **Implementation Time:** Practice transformation takes time
- **No Standalone Software:** Must use full consulting service

### Alternatives
- **Technology Consultants:** Independent practice management consultants
- **Coaching Programs:** Various advisor coaching programs
- **Software Vendors:** E.g., eMoney, RightCapital (for planning software needs)
- **Practice Management Firms:** Larger consulting firms
- **Peer Groups:** Advisor networking groups
- **Industry Associations:** FPA, NAPFA resources

### Use Cases

#### Ideal For:
- **Advisors Seeking Systematization:** Practices needing to organize workflows
- **Growing Firms:** Advisors scaling from solo to multi-advisor
- **Practice Management Focus:** Advisors prioritizing business efficiency
- **Technology-Overwhelmed Advisors:** Those needing help selecting/ implementing tools
- **Compliance-Focused Practices:** Needing documentation systems
- **Team-Building Advisors:** Growing teams needing structure
- **Client Service Excellence:** Firms wanting to elevate service delivery
- **Independence-Focused Advisors:** Seeking support for independent practice

#### Not Ideal For:
- **Solo Advisors Not Ready to Invest Time:** Requires significant commitment
- **Firms Needing Software Only:** Looking for standalone software
- **Budget-Conscious Practices:** Consulting requires investment
- **Quick-Fix Needs:** Consulting is process-driven, not instant
- **DIY Technologists:** Those who prefer self-implementing technology
- **Small, Stable Practices:** No growth or change needed
- **Direct Software Purchase:** Seeking product, not service

### Key Differentiators
1. **Founder-Led Consulting:** Deborah Fox personally leads engagements (30+ years experience)
2. **Advisor-to-Advisor:** Built by advisors for advisors (not corporate consulting)
3. **Proven Track Record:** InvestmentNews Innovator recognition
4. **Comprehensive System:** Addresses technology, people, and processes together
5. **Long-Term Relationship Focus:** Ongoing support vs. one-time project
6. **Industry Recognition:** Featured in major financial publications
7. **Practice Management Expertise:** Deep specialization in advisor business models
8. **Flexible Engagement Models:** Works with various practice sizes and stages
9. **Revenue Integration:** Fox College Funding partnership opportunity
10. **Turnkey System:** Delivered ready-to-implement
